testcase.classname: As an administrator, I want to be able to create a new FAQ record via API connection.
testcase.name: When a POST request containing valid authorization credentials and necessary information
testcase.system-out: * The api user constructs the base url with the "admin" token...............passed * The api user sets "api/faqsAdd" path parameters...........................passed * The api user adds a key field "title" with the value "newFaqTitle" to the request body.passed * The api user adds a key field "description" with the value "newFaqDescription" to the request body.passed * The api user sends the "post" request and saves the "Response"............passed * The api user verifies that for "post" request type the status code is 201 and the message information in the response body is "Faqs added successfully".passed

testcase.classname: As an administrator, I want to be able to create a new FAQ record via API connection.
testcase.name: The creation of the new FAQ record via the API should be verified through the API itself by sending a GET
testcase.system-out: * The api user constructs the base url with the "admin" token...............passed * The api user sets "api/faqsDetails" path parameters.......................passed * The api user adds a key field "id" with the value "added_item_id" to the request body.passed * The api user sends the "getbody" request and saves the "Response".........passed * The api user verifies that "added_item_id" returned in the response body by sending a GET request to the "faqsDetails" endpoint.passed

testcase.classname: As an administrator, I want to be able to access the FAQ's list via API connection.
testcase.name: When a GET request with valid authorization information is sent to the /api/refundReasonList endpoint
testcase.system-out: * The api user constructs the base url with the "admin" token...............passed * The api user sets "api/faqsList" path parameters..........................passed * The api user sends the "get" request and saves the "response".............passed * The api user verifies that for "get" request type the status code is 200 and the message information in the response body is "success".passed

testcase.classname: As an administrator, I want to be able to access the FAQ's list via API connection.
testcase.name: When a GET request with valid authorization information is sent to the /api/refundReasonList endpoint 2
testcase.system-out: * The api user constructs the base url with the "admin" token...............passed * The api user sets "api/faqsList" path parameters..........................passed * The api user sends the "get" request and saves the "response".............passed * The api user verifies that for "get" request type the status code is 200 and the message information in the response body is "success".passed

testcase.classname: As an administrator, I want to be able to update the information
testcase.name: When a PATCH request containing valid authorization credentials, the FAQ id to be updated, and
testcase.system-out: * The api user constructs the base url with the "admin" token...............passed * The api user sets "api/faqsUpdate/120" path parameters....................passed * The api user adds a key field "title" with the value "updatedTitle" to the request body.passed * The api user adds a key field "description" with the value "updatedDescription" to the request body.passed * The api user sends the "patch" request and saves the "Response"...........passed * The api user verifies that for "patch" request type the status code is 202 and the message information in the response body is "faqs updated successfully".passed

testcase.classname: As an administrator, I want to be able to delete the record specified by the FAQ's id via the API connection.
testcase.name: When a DELETE request containing valid authorization credentials and the FAQ's id to be deleted is sent to the /api/faqsDelete endpoint,

failure.message: status code: 404, reason phrase: Not Found

testcase.failure:
* The api user constructs the base url with the "admin" token...............passed * The api user sets "api/faqsDelete" path parameters........................passed * The api user prepares a GET request containing the 190 for which details are to be accessed.passed * The api user sends the "delete" request and saves the "Response"..........failed * The api user verifies that for "delete" request type the status code is 202 and the message information in the response body is "faqs deleted successfully".skipped * The api user verifies that the Deleted id information in the response body is the same as the id information in the request body..skipped
